abstract.p: This proposal defines a module for providing conversions between various XPath Data Model datatypes. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.
As this is a work in progress, more details about it can be found at Datatype Conversion Functions Comparison.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This module is designed to help datatypes handling, providing conversions between datatypes that are not covered by casts mentioned in .

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/datatype-conversion. In this document, the dt-conv prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, the err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: xs:base64Binary to other datatypes
div1.p: These functions provide conversion from xs:base64Binary datatype to other datatypes.

div2.head: The dt-conv:base64Binary-to-byte function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:base64Binary to xs:byte.

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.

div2.head: The dt-conv:base64Binary-to-string function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:base64Binary to xs:string.
div2.eg: dt-conv:base64Binary-to-string($data as xs:base64Binary?, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$encoding is the encoding used for conversion. The default value is UTF-8. If it is specified an unsupported encoding, this is an error .

div1.head: xs:byte to other datatypes
div1.p: These functions provide conversion from xs:byte datatype to other datatypes.

div2.head: The dt-conv:byte-to-base64Binary function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:byte to xs:base64Binary.

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.

div2.head: The dt-conv:byte-to-hexBinary function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:byte to xs:hexBinary.

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.

div1.head: xs:hexBinary to other datatypes
div1.p: These functions provide conversion from xs:hexBinary datatype to other datatypes.

div2.head: The dt-conv:hexBinary-to-byte function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:hexBinary to xs:byte.

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.

div2.head: The dt-conv:hexBinary-to-string function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:hexBinary to xs:string.
div2.eg: dt-conv:hexBinary-to-string($data as xs:hexBinary?, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:string?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$encoding is the encoding used for conversion. The default value is UTF-8. If it is specified an unsupported encoding, this is an error .

div1.head: xs:string to other datatypes
div1.p: These functions provide conversion from xs:string datatype to other datatypes.

div2.head: The dt-conv:string-to-base64Binary function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:string to xs:base64Binary.
div2.eg: dt-conv:string-to-base64Binary($data as xs:string?, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$encoding is the encoding used for conversion. The default value is UTF-8. If it is specified an unsupported encoding, this is an error .

div2.head: The dt-conv:string-to-hexBinary function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:string to xs:hexBinary.
div2.eg: dt-conv:string-to-hexBinary($data as xs:string?, $encoding as xs:string) as xs:hexBinary?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$encoding is the encoding used for conversion. The default value is UTF-8. If it is specified an unsupported encoding, this is an error .

div2.head: The dt-conv:string-to-integer function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:string to xs:integer.
div2.eg: dt-conv:string-to-integer($data as xs:string?, $radix as xs:integer) as xs:integer?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$radix is the radix used to provide the conversion of $data ($data is considered being in radix $radix).

div1.head: xs:integer to other datatypes
div1.p: These functions provide conversion from xs:integer datatype to other datatypes.

div2.head: The dt-conv:integer-to-string function
div2.p: This function converts from xs:integer to xs:string.
div2.eg: dt-conv:integer-to-string($data as xs:integer?, $radix as xs:integer) as xs:string?

item.p: $data is the data to be converted.
$radix is the radix used to provide the conversion of $data.
